pros: Caring staff and management, great cafeteria too!
cons: COVID has not been kind on the budget.

pros: Good teamwork Decent benefits Small l, tight knit community feel

pros: The graveyard crew was such a close nit family.

review_title: San Gorgonio Memorial Hospital has a family feel.
pros: Thankful to have the CEO that we do. Mr. Steve Barron. He is awesome!
cons: Wish we were a larger hospital that could afford to increase salary of our hospital staff.

pros: Newer hospital add-ons are nice
cons: I have nothing negative to say about this facility

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Banning, CA
pros: There are some great people that work in the laboratory and really care about patients.
cons: The laboratory department seems to be under appreciated by other departments.

pros: Pay, staff, friendly and hospital
cons: Always busy, mix own meds

review_title: Best Place I Have Ever Worked
pros: I'm currently working as a web developer at SGMH and have been here for three months so far. I must say that it has been such a positive experience. Upper management is deeply involved in building the community and making the experience at the hospital as pleasant as possible. Everyone is committed to serving the patient and each other, I'm finding more and more the brevity of the love shown throughout the hospital staff.
cons: There is nothing that I can think of that I would change. I couldn't ask for a better team.

pros: Good benefits such as PTO sick time and insurance. Decent parking. The company values are good if they would be followed. Good security.
cons: Major amount of favoritism played. Director likes to play employees against each other. The people in higher positions do not pay attention to what is going on. Unless your liked by certain people everything you do and say will be used against you in a negative way. Human resources does not listen to you they are there for the directors only not the lower people.

pros:
This little community hospital has come a long way in the 8 years that I have been here.
Great staff, family friendly supportive feel, great team work and a real sense that we are here for our patients and our community.  Over the years all has improved from benefits to pay.  We also have a lot of fun activities through out the year.
cons: I cannot really think of any.  No where is perfect all the time but I am very grateful to be here at San G!

job_title: Rapid Care Secretary in Redlands, CA
pros: Coworkers were the best part of this job.
cons: Pay was cut 2 months after I started working there. They decided to cut pay because they were changing the responsibilities involved with my position, however the work load remained just as heavy for a much lower wage. 12 hour shifts with no break, but we were required to clock out for lunch even when we did not get one.

review_title: Supportive and Friendly Staff on Med/Surg Unit
pros: Started as a new grad and was warmly welcomed by the staff.  The other nurses want you to do well and do what they can to help if you need it.  The director of med/surg has high expectations of her staff and truly cares about the patients.
cons: Small hospital.  Only one surgeon.

pros: This place is my second family! Everyone is so friendly and are genuinely great people! I could not work anywhere else!
cons: I can honestly say I can't find any cons about working here. The management team we have is wonderful and understanding, they genuinely care about the employees.

pros: Management and higher up stay available to staff. Departments work well together.
cons: HR needs to improve on how they communicate and deliver information. Often felt intimidated into accepting unacceptable circumstances.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Banning, CA
pros: Great place to be! We wow!
cons: We are contagiously NICE!!!! Cant help it!

pros: The workplace is so toxic it makes daily life outside of work seem much better in contrast.
cons: Too many to list. A lot of children in adults bodies.

pros: Great family feel.  Upper management encourages further education and internal promotions.
cons: Older equipment and Paragon/McKesson charting systems.

pros: My co-workers that I shared the days with were great.

pros: Small Hospital, not too stressful.
